comments:
From using version 2.1, I just changed to Version: 3.0.0 Build id: 200406251208

With v3, I find that printing does not work for text editor, java editor or 
apparently any editor.  The print window comes up and everthing looks ok. But I 
click on PRINT, the printer runs and then spits out a blank page, with nothing 
on it. (Confirmed Brother HL-1440 printer is working for my other application 
software)

What is up?

Maybe I did conversion to 3.0 incorrectly?  I just pointed new eclipse to my 
old 2.1 workspace.  Note: all my projects are outside my workspace directory.
Is there anything in the .log file?

>>Is there anything in the .log file?
No.  I don't see anything about printing.  I tried printing a couple times and 
nothing shows in .metadata/.log

Eclipse application appears to print, without any visible errors.  Again, I get 
the print response window and click on the Print button and Eclipse then prints 
either one or two blank pages.  

FYI, I also upgraded to latest Windows 2000 service pack and still cannot print.

PS: I have multiple workspaces, and I'm still using Eclipse 2.1 on another 
workspace.  Maybe there are common dll's in 2.1 that Eclipse 3 might 
erroniously be using.  (I have tried rebooting machine and launched version 3 
only, but still could not print)  Is there a windows registry entry pointing to 
wrong dll's?
Upgraded to j2re1.4.2_05. Still only blank pages are output.
Nick can you print from Win2k on Eclipse R3.0?

If you open eclipse R3.0 on a new empty workspace, then create a new file (text
or java) and print from an editor, does this work?

I created a new shortcut that pointed to a new empty workspace. From this, I 
opened eclipse v3.0, created new project inside workspace and new project 
outside workspace.  And created java file and test file in each.  Java editor 
and text editor print out single blank page.

I'm using Suse Linux 9.1 and I have identical issues. I can't print anything 
with verison 3.0.0. T
It works for me on Win2K.
Re comment #8, printing is not currently supported on Linux.  See bug 24796.

I'd like to see if anyone on the SWT team has some investigative questions 
here.  I don't think this is a UI bug since Nick has no problems on his 
machine.

I don't agree I don't think that is a problem about linux because there is a 
similar issue for Windows 200 o.s.. The same object that manages printer works 
well under mozilla and the command kprinter --stdin works well in a terminal.

The bug report says "Cannot print anything" on Windows 2000.  SSQ to confirm 
that printing works in Eclipse 3.0 on Windows 2000.  If so, close as 
WORKSFORME or investigate further with James.  James, do other applications 
print fine?

Created an attachment (id=13451)
test

I can print from eclipse 3.0 on Win2k and WinXp without problems.

James, please could you run the attached test and see if it is working properly
on your machine? Thanks.

Sorry for slow response.
>> do other applications print fine?
Yes all my applications including Eclipse 2.1 print ok.  Eclipse 3 just prints 
out one or two blank pages.

---------------------------
Included ws\win32\swt.jar in classpath.  Ran PR69067 class and had fatal error:
java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no swt-win32-3062 in java.library.path
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.Runtime.loadLibrary0(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.System.loadLibrary(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.Library.loadLibrary(Library.java:100)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.win32.OS.<clinit>(OS.java:18)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Device.init(Device.java:564)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.init(Display.java:1780)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Device.<init>(Device.java:100)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.<init>(Display.java:355)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.<init>(Display.java:351)
	at PR69067.main(PR69067.java:10)
Exception in thread "main" 

----------------------
I added following parameter to 'VM arguments' in Run window.  
   -Djava.library.path=c:/java/eclipse/v3/eclipse/plugins
      /org.eclipse.swt.win32_3.0.0/os/win32/x86

Now the window pops up.  I clicked on print button and printer printed out page 
with two strings output like below, in large font in upper left hand corner. 
Note that String1 and String3 did not print out.
----------
String0

String2



----------

So it seems that the TextLayout drawing is falling somehow. TextLayout is 
implemented using the Uniscribe API instead of GDI (GC.drawString()).

Felipe, do you have any idea why this is falling?
James, did the diagonal lines printed OK?

>>did the diagonal lines printed OK?
No. The only things that printed was 'String0' and 'String2'.

Maybe this is pertinent.  I am using Spring plugin and it has dependency on 
GEF, so I have GEF plugin installed too.  This has something to do with 
graphics so maybe it is conficting with swt stuff.
I don't know what is going on, first time I see this problem.

I am very sorry.  I went and looked at the print out again.  There is two very 
very light thin lines--almost invisible--that cross at the center of the page 
diagonally and extend to the corners of page.  With the room a bit dark last 
night, I didn't see them before.

I just found something interesting.  In 'Printing Preferences' window in 
'Advanced' tab for my HL-1440 printer, I changed to high resolution '1200x600' 
and checked 'Improved gray printing'.

Then I printed a java file in java editor, of Eclipse 3.0.  And something 
printed on page.  It was the light blue horizontal bar that highlights the 
current line in the editor.  I repeat, all that printed was a light gray bar 
exactly where the highlighting bar had been in the editor.

Hope this helps your diagnosis.
